item.title: High Energy Batteries Q2 FY26: Defence Specialist Struggles with Margin Compression Despite Revenue Growth
item.description: High Energy Batteries (India) Ltd., a specialised battery manufacturer serving India's defence forces and launch vehicle programmes, reported net profit of ₹2.01 crores for Q2 FY26, representing a sequential increase of 157.69% from Q1 FY26's ₹0.78 crores but a year-on-year decline of 11.67% from ₹2.27 crores in Q2 FY25. The ₹504.00 crore market capitalisation company, trading at ₹562.60 per share, faces mounting concerns over deteriorating operational efficiency despite topline expansion. Time: Jan 31 2026 09:46 PM IST

item.title: Yaan Enterprises Q2 FY26: Marginal Growth Fails to Justify Expensive Valuation
item.description: Yaan Enterprises Ltd., a micro-cap tour and travel services provider, reported modest financial results for Q2 FY26, with net profit standing at ₹0.02 crores, unchanged sequentially but declining 33.33% year-on-year. The company's market capitalisation of ₹31.00 crores reflects a premium valuation that appears increasingly difficult to justify given the weak operational metrics and deteriorating profitability trends. Time: Jan 31 2026 09:46 PM IST

item.title: Ind-Swift Laboratories Q2 FY26: Recovery Gains Momentum Amid Operational Challenges
item.description: Ind-Swift Laboratories Limited, the Chandigarh-based active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) manufacturer, reported a consolidated net profit of ₹7.99 crores for Q2 FY26 (July-September 2025), marking a dramatic turnaround from the ₹0.41 crores reported in the corresponding quarter last year. This represents an extraordinary year-on-year growth of 1,848.78%, though the quarter-on-quarter performance showed a marginal decline of 8.89% from Q1 FY26's ₹8.77 crores. The stock surged 5.52% following the results announcement, closing at ₹113.34 on January 30, 2026, reflecting renewed investor confidence in the company's recovery trajectory. Time: Jan 31 2026 09:45 PM IST

item.title: Sumuka Agro Q2 FY26: Strong Revenue Growth Masks Margin Compression Concerns
item.description: Sumuka Agro Industries Ltd., a micro-cap player in India's FMCG sector with a market capitalisation of ₹176.00 crores, reported net profit of ₹0.75 crores for Q2 FY26 ending September 2025, marking a sequential decline of 8.54% quarter-on-quarter but a remarkable turnaround of 294.74% year-on-year. The company's shares closed at ₹249.50 on January 30, 2026, down 2.79% on the day, though the stock has delivered an impressive 40.56% year-on-year revenue growth, significantly outperforming its FMCG sector peers. Time: Jan 31 2026 09:45 PM IST

item.title: Asit C Mehta Financial Services Q2 FY26: Profit Surge Masks Underlying Volatility Concerns
item.description: Asit C Mehta Financial Services Ltd., a Mumbai-based capital markets firm, reported a consolidated net profit of ₹1.45 crores for Q2 FY26, swinging sharply from a loss of ₹2.28 crores in the previous quarter. However, the year-on-year comparison reveals a troubling picture, with profits plunging 526.47% from ₹0.34 crores loss in Q2 FY25. The micro-cap stock, with a market capitalisation of ₹107.00 crores, traded at ₹133.00 on January 30, 2026, reflecting a modest 2.31% single-day gain but remains down 10.80% year-to-date. Time: Jan 31 2026 09:45 PM IST

item.title: Mixed Earnings Landscape as Nearly Half of Companies Report Profit Growth in Dec-2025 Quarter
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture of corporate performance, with 49.0% of the 943 companies declaring results posting positive outcomes. This marks a notable improvement from the preceding quarters, reflecting a gradual recovery in profitability across sectors and market capitalisation segments. Time: Jan 31 2026 09:00 PM IST

item.title: Ratnaveer Precision Engineering Q2 FY26: Strong Momentum Continues Amid Margin Pressures
item.description: Ratnaveer Precision Engineering Ltd., a micro-cap player in the iron and steel products sector, reported its second consecutive quarter of robust growth in Q2 FY26, with net profit rising 3.21% quarter-on-quarter to ₹15.43 crores from ₹14.95 crores in Q1 FY26. On a year-on-year basis, net profit expanded 25.68% from ₹12.28 crores in Q2 FY25, demonstrating the company's ability to capitalise on favourable industry dynamics. However, the ₹1,063 crore market capitalisation company faces headwinds from margin compression, with operating margins declining to 9.90% from 10.21% in the previous quarter, raising questions about the sustainability of its profitability trajectory. Time: Jan 31 2026 08:32 PM IST

item.title: Steel City Securities Q3 FY26: Margin Pressures Mount Amid Revenue Decline
item.description: Steel City Securities Ltd., a Visakhapatnam-based stockbroker and e-governance services company, reported consolidated net profit of ₹3.72 crores for Q3 FY26 (Oct-Dec'25), marking an 18.85% quarter-on-quarter increase but a concerning 23.30% year-on-year decline. With a market capitalisation of ₹125.00 crores and a current price of ₹84.28, the micro-cap capital markets firm faces mounting pressure as revenue continues its downward trajectory whilst operating margins compress significantly from prior-year levels. Time: Jan 31 2026 08:32 PM IST

item.title: Alfa Transformers Q3 FY26: Micro-Cap Struggles Deepen Amid Persistent Losses
item.description: Alfa Transformers Limited, a Bhubaneswar-based electrical equipment manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹27.00 crores, continues to grapple with operational challenges as its stock price plummeted 70.30% over the past year. Trading at ₹29.05 as of January 30, 2026, the micro-cap company's shares have underperformed the broader market by a staggering 77.48 percentage points, reflecting deep-seated investor concerns about its financial trajectory and competitive positioning in the Other Electrical Equipment sector. Time: Jan 31 2026 08:31 PM IST

item.title: Shree Hari Chemicals Q3 FY26: Profit Plunges 65% as Margin Pressures Mount
item.description: Shree Hari Chemicals Export Ltd., a micro-cap dye intermediates manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹68.00 crores, reported a sharp 65.44% quarter-on-quarter decline in consolidated net profit to ₹1.22 crores for Q3 FY26, down from ₹3.53 crores in Q2 FY26. The steep fall came despite a sequential revenue decline of 40.27%, as net sales dropped to ₹44.49 crores from ₹74.49 crores in the preceding quarter. Operating margins compressed sharply to 4.88% from 7.09%, reflecting mounting cost pressures and operational challenges in the commodity chemicals sector. Time: Jan 31 2026 08:30 PM IST

item.title: Zen Technologies Q3 FY26: Growth Momentum Stalls Amid Execution Challenges
item.description: Zen Technologies Ltd., a leading defence simulator manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹12,482 crores, reported a consolidated net profit of ₹54.77 crores for Q3 FY26, marking a sequential decline of 7.79% from the previous quarter. The results reveal a concerning deceleration in the company's growth trajectory, with revenue growth moderating to just 2.45% quarter-on-quarter, whilst year-on-year consolidated profit growth of 37.89% masked underlying execution challenges. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:31 PM IST

item.title: GAIL (India) Q3 FY26: Profit Plunges 57% as Margin Pressures Intensify
item.description: GAIL (India) Ltd., the nation's largest state-owned natural gas processing and distribution company, reported a sharp 56.97% year-on-year decline in consolidated net profit for Q3 FY26, with earnings falling to ₹1,756.17 crores from ₹4,081.56 crores in the corresponding quarter last year. The results, announced for the quarter ending December 2025, reveal mounting operational pressures as the company grapples with contracting margins and subdued revenue growth despite its commanding ₹109,015 crore market capitalisation. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:31 PM IST

item.title: Incap Ltd Q2 FY26: Revenue Plunge and Margin Pressure Trigger Sharp Concerns
item.description: Incap Limited, a Vijayawada-based manufacturer of aluminium electrolytic capacitors, reported deeply concerning results for Q2 FY26, with net profit declining 26.67% quarter-on-quarter to ₹0.22 crores from ₹0.30 crores in Q1 FY26. On a year-on-year basis, the micro-cap company witnessed a steeper 51.11% decline from ₹0.45 crores in Q2 FY25. The stock, currently trading at ₹75.00 with a market capitalisation of ₹36.00 crores, surged 6.99% in the trading session following the results announcement, though this appears to be a technical bounce rather than fundamental optimism. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:30 PM IST

item.title: Vishnu Chemicals Q3 FY26: Modest Growth Amid Rising Interest Costs
item.description: Vishnu Chemicals Limited, a Hyderabad-based specialty chromium chemicals manufacturer, reported a marginal decline in net profit for Q3 FY26, with earnings of ₹33.76 crores compared to ₹34.40 crores in Q3 FY25, representing a year-on-year decline of 1.86%. However, on a sequential basis, the company posted a modest improvement of 2.68% from Q2 FY26's ₹32.88 crores. The stock traded at ₹522.45 on January 30, 2026, up 1.20% from the previous close, giving the company a market capitalisation of ₹3,453 crores. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:30 PM IST

item.title: Are Northern ARC Capital Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Northern ARC Capital Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results are strong, with record revenue of ₹721.14 crores and a net profit of ₹100.76 crores, both showing significant growth. However, the company faces challenges with margin compression and a high debt-to-equity ratio, indicating mixed financial performance. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:30 PM IST

item.title: Are Odigma Consultancy Solutions Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Odigma Consultancy Solutions Ltd's latest results are poor, showing a 23.95% decline in net sales and a net loss of ₹1.44 crores, indicating significant operational challenges and a deteriorating financial position. The company is struggling with declining profitability and a loss of institutional investor confidence. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:30 PM IST

item.title: Are ESAF Small Finance Bank Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: ESAF Small Finance Bank Ltd's latest results are concerning, showing a net loss of ₹115.81 crores for Q3 FY26, declining revenues, and rising non-performing assets, indicating significant operational challenges and a negative return on equity. The bank faces a tough road to recovery, requiring improvements in asset quality and profitability. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:30 PM IST

item.title: Are Doms Industries Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Doms Industries Ltd's Q3 FY26 results show strong revenue growth with net sales of ₹592.19 crores, but profit growth is slowing, raising concerns about sustainability. While the company maintains a solid return on equity, its high P/E ratio suggests investors should carefully assess its valuation amid margin pressures. Time: Jan 31 2026 07:30 PM IST
